title: Sigma V9.924 Sigma Hardware and Software Requirements Sept 2024
text: Sigma Hardware and Software Requirements The following hardware and software recommendations are made by K3 based on the experience of our customers and the operating system author’s recommendations. These requirements are effective as of September 2024 and are subject to change without notice. Minimum Hardware and Software Requirements Server Hardware Minimum Recommended Processor Speed Dual core Quad core Memory 4GB 8GB or greater Hard Disk (Free Space) SATA 7200rpm SSD / M.2 RAID-5 (SAS) Important Notes Tape Backup and UPS (battery backup) highly recommended. Hardware must comply with operating system author’s hardware compatibility list. Hardware specifications are based on a dedicated server and 20 concurrent users, if the server has additional workloads placed upon it, they should be factored into these recommendations. Server Software Supported Server Operating Systems Windows 2022 server Windows 2019 server Windows 2016 server Important Notes We do not recommend Windows Small Business Server, for sites larger than 20 concurrent Sigma users. However please discuss with support if this is a requirement. Client Hardware Minimum Recommended Processor Speed 1GHz 2 GHz+ RAM 512MB 1GB+ Hard Disk (Free Space) 5GB 10GB Network Adaptor 100 Base-T 1000 Base-T Display Settings SVGA (1024x768) SVGA (1024 x 768 or greater) Other Hardware Requirements Hardware must comply with operating system author’s hardware compatibility list. Isolated power circuits with surge protection or UPS recommended. Client Software Supported Client Operating Systems Windows 10 Professional or Enterprise Windows 11 Professional or Enterprise Note: To use 64bit Windows clients you will require the appropriate option. Contact your account manager for details.

title: Sigma Financials Data Files
text: Sigma Financials Data Files Sigma Sales creates the following data files for each sales ledger: SASCBAT.nnn Control file for transaction batches imported from the K3-Omnis system. SBALS.nnn Account balances file. This file holds the total debt, turnover, and other balances for each customer account. SDETS.nnn Transaction details file. This file holds the detail lines entered on each transaction. SECVAT.nnn EC VAT file. This file holds details of the items that are to appear on the EC Sales List report. SINPUT.nnn Parameter file for account record import. SLOCK.nnn Record locking file used during account record import. SMAST.nnn Account master file. This file holds details of all your customers. SMASTNDX.nnn Account index file. This is the index file for SMAST.nnn. SMICROSS.nnn Parameter file relating to the K3-Omnis system and used during account record import. SOPEN.nnn Open batch file. This file holds details of each transaction batch entered in the current period and not yet accepted. SPARM.nnn Parameter file. This file holds a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the ledger to be processed. It includes such items as report printing sequences, transaction definitions, analysis description and so on, which you specify as described in Section 16.3 Setup. SPARMVAT.nnn VAT parameters file. This file holds details of all of the VAT codes, descriptions and rates that you have defined. SREPS.nnn User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the sales ledger in use. SSORTNDX.nnn Print sort file. This file holds the alternative sequences for reports. SSTATNDX.nnn EC trade statistics index file. This is the index file for SSTATS.nnn. SSTATPRM.nnn EC trade statistics parameter file. This file holds the EC trade statistics defaults. SSTATS.nnn EC trade statistics data file. This file contains details of all trade statistics data entered into the ledger. All trade statistics are held on this file until they are cleared. STANLNDX.nnn Transaction analysis index file. This is the index file for STRANANL.nnn. STEXT.nnn Account text file. This file holds the name, address, analysis codes for each customer account. STRAN.nnn Transaction file. This file contains details of all transactions entered into the ledger. All transactions are held on this file until they are cleared and have been processed by the period end routines. STRANANL.nnn Transaction analysis file. This file contains transaction analysis text entered as part of the transaction details, such as VAT number and country code. SVAT.nnn VAT details file. This file holds the VAT details entered for each transaction. SXLOG.nnn Exchange transaction file (dual currency ledgers only). This file holds details of all transactions that have been affected by exchange variances during the period. Sigma Sales also creates the following system and user files: CONTuu.OMS Private user control file. SALOCuu.nnn Temporary file created during payment allocations. SCONT.OMS The Sigma Sales system control file. SDDETuu.nnn Temporary post-dated transaction details file. SDUMPuu.nnn Temporary post-dated transaction file. SDVATuu.nnn Temporary post-dated VAT details file. SDVuuNDX.nnn Temporary transaction batch index file. SEXTrruu.nnn User-defined report output file for input to spreadsheet or database (rr is the report number). SLEDGER.OMS Sigma Sales ledger file. This file contains a list of the sales ledgers that you have defined. SLNANART.nnn Temporary transaction analysis file used during period end processing. SLOK.OMS Report writer locking file. SNOMIXuu.nnn Temporary index file used during production of sales analysis reports. SNOMSuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of sales analysis reports. SREPrruu.nnn User-defined report output file (rr is the report number). SREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). SREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that may be used by all sales ledgers. SSORTAuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. SSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. SSUMMuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of sales analysis reports. SSTATTMP.nnn Temporary file used during clearance of EC trade statistics. SSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each ledger. STEXTuu.TMP Temporary file used during reorganisation of account analysis parameters. SUSERbbb.nnn Transaction import file for batch bbb. SUSERSEL.OMS User-defined report selection choices file. The system also creates the following files for open batches of transactions: SDETSbb.nnn Open batch transaction details file. STANLbb.nnn Open batch transaction analysis file. STRANbb.nnn Open batch transaction file. SVATbb.nnn Open batch VAT details file. Sigma Purchase creates the following data files for each purchase ledger: PBALS.nnn Account balances file. This file holds the total debt, turnover, and other balances for each supplier account. PBANK.nnn Bank details file. This file holds bank account details for those suppliers who are paid by bank giro, and the cheque payee name for those suppliers paid by cheque where the name of the payee is longer than the space allowed on the account master file. PCASH.nnn Sigma Cash interface file. This file holds details of transactions that are to be interfaced with the Sigma Cash Cash Book system. PDETS.nnn Transaction details file. This file holds the detail lines entered on each transaction. PINPUT.nnn Parameter file for account record import. PIRDETS.nnn Invoice Register transaction details file. This file holds the detail lines entered on each Invoice Register transaction. PIRDETIX.nnn Invoice Register details file index. This is the index file for PIRDETS.nnn. PIRINDEX.nnn Invoice Register transaction index file. This is the index file for PIRTRAN.nnn. PIROPEN.nnn Invoice Register open batch file. This file holds details of each Invoice Register transaction batch entered but not yet accepted. PIRTRAN.nnn Invoice Register transaction file. This file contains details of all transactions entered into the Invoice Register. All Invoice Register transactions are held on this file until they are transferred to the purchase ledger. PIRTRANL.nnn Invoice Register transaction analysis file. This file contains transaction analysis text entered as part of the Invoice Register transaction details, such as VAT number and country code. PIRTANDX.nnn Invoice Register transaction analysis index file. This is the index file for PIRTRANL.nnn. PIRVAT.nnn Invoice Register VAT details file. This holds the VAT details entered for each Invoice Register transaction. PLOCK.nnn Record locking file used during account record import. PMAST.nnn Account master file. This file holds details of all your suppliers. PMASTNDX.nnn Account index file. This is the index file for PMAST.nnn. PMICROSS.nnn Parameter file relating to the K3-Micross system and used during account record import. PMPTRN.nnn The Sigma Supply interface file. This file holds information on invoices and credit notes entered into Sigma Purchase for interface to the associated Sigma Supply ledger. POPEN.nnn Open batch file. This file holds details of each transaction batch entered in the current period and not yet accepted. PPARM.nnn Parameter file. This file holds a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the ledger to be processed. It includes such items as report printing sequences, transaction definitions, analysis description and so on, which you specify as described in Section 16.3. PPARMVAT.nnn VAT parameters file. This file holds details of all of the VAT codes, descriptions and rates that you have defined. PPAYS.nnn Payments detail file. This file holds details of the provisional payments list. PPAYSNDX.nnn Payments index file. This is the index file for PPAYS.nnn. PREPS.nnn User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the purchase ledger in use. PSORTNDX.nnn Print sort file. This file holds the alternative sequences for reports. PSTATNDX.nnn EC trade statistics index file. This is the index file for PSTATS.nnn. PSTATPRM.nnn EC trade statistics parameter file. This file holds the EC trade statistics defaults. PSTATS.nnn EC trade statistics data file. This file contains details of all trade statistics data entered into the ledger. All trade statistics are held on this file until they are cleared. PTANLNDX.nnn Transaction analysis index file. This is the index file for PTRANANL.nnn. PTEXT.nnn Account text file. This file holds the name, address, analysis codes for each supplier account. PTRAN.nnn Transaction file. This file contains details of all transactions entered into the ledger. All transactions are held on this file until they are cleared and have been processed by the period end routines. PTRANANL.nnn Transaction analysis file. This file contains transaction analysis text entered as part of the transaction details, such as VAT number and country code. PVAT.nnn VAT details file. This file holds the VAT details entered for each transaction. PVOIDCHQ.nnn Void cheque file. This file holds details of the void cheques printed by the system. PXLOG.nnn Exchange transaction file (dual currency ledgers only). This file holds details of all transactions that have been affected by exchange variances during the period. Sigma Bought also creates the following system and user files: CONTuu.OMS Private user control file. PALOCuu.nnn Temporary file created during payment allocations. PCONT.OMS The Sigma Purchase system control file. PDUMPuu.nnn Temporary post-dated transaction file. PDVuuNDX.nnn Temporary transaction batch index file. PEXTrruu.nnn User-defined report output file for input to spreadsheet or database (rr is the report number). PIRDTPbb.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction details file. PIRNART.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction file used during period end processing. PIRSTED.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction details file used during period end processing. PIRTANuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction analysis file. PIRTAPuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction analysis file. PIRTAV.nnn Temporary Invoice Register VAT details file used during period end processing. PIRTNPuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction file. PIRVTPuu.nnn Temporary Invoice Register VAT details file. PLEDGER.OMS Sigma Purchase ledger file. This file contains a list of the purchase ledgers that you have defined. PLNANART.nnn Temporary transaction analysis file used during period end processing. PLNARTRI.nnn Temporary Invoice Register transaction analysis file used during period end processing. PLOK.OMS Report writer locking file. PNOMIXuu.nnn Temporary index file used during production of purchase analysis reports. PNOMSuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of purchase analysis reports. PREPrruu.nnn User-defined report output file (rr is the report number). PREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). PREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that may be used by all purchase ledgers. PSORTAuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. PSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. PSUMMuu.nnn Temporary file used during production of purchase analysis reports. PSTATTMP.nnn Temporary file used during clearance of EC trade statistics. PSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each ledger. PTEXTuu.TMP Temporary file used during reorganisation of account analysis parameters. PUSERbbb.nnn Transaction import file for batch bbb. PUSERSEL.OMS User-defined report selection choices file. The system also creates the following files for open batches of transactions: PDETSbb.nnn Open batch transaction details file. PTANLbb.nnn Open batch transaction analysis file. PTRANbb.nnn Open batch transaction file. PVATbb.nnn Open batch VAT details file. PIRDETbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch transaction details file. PIRTALbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch transaction analysis file. PIRTRNbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch transaction file. PIRVATbb.nnn Invoice Register open batch VAT details file. Sigma General Ledger creates the following data files for each general ledger: NCANLNDX.nnn Cost centre analysis file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the cost centre analysis file. NCOMBI.nnn Cost centre/account codes combinations file. This file contains details of the cost centre and account code combinations that you have defined. NCOMBNDX.nnn Cost centre/account codes combinations file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the cost centre/account codes combinations file. NCOST.nnn Cost centre master file. This file contains all the valid cost centre codes that you have set up for this ledger. Whenever you enter transactions, this master file is accessed to check that the cost centre code is valid and that postings to the cost centre are permitted. NCOSTANL.nnn Cost centre analysis file. This file contains the analysis codes entered for each cost centre. NCOSTNDX.nnn Cost centre master file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the cost centre master file more quickly. NDANLNDX.nnn Transaction dump file analysis index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the transaction dump file analysis file. NDUMP.nnn Transaction dump file. This file contains the transactions held in the system but not released for posting. It includes diarised journals, recurring journals, accruals and post-dated transactions. It also holds any "saved" journals until they are completed and accepted into the system. NDUMPANL.nnn Transaction dump file analysis file. This file contains the analysis codes entered for each transaction record held in the dump file. NEQUIV.nnn Interface equivalences file. This file contains details of the interface equivalences used when integrating data from other Sigma Systems modules. NEQVNDX.nnn Interface equivalences index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the interface equivalences file. NMANLNDX.nnn Account code analysis file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the account code analysis file. NMAST.nnn Account code master file. This file contains all the valid account codes that you have set up for this ledger (see Section 5.2). Whenever you enter transactions, this master file is accessed to check that the account code is valid and that postings to the account are permitted. NMASTANL.nnn Account code analysis file. This file contains the analysis codes entered for each account code. NMASTNDX.nnn Account code master file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the account code master file more quickly. NPARM.nnn Parameter file. This file contains a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the ledger to be processed. It includes such items as calendar details, account details, transaction definitions and so on, which you specify. NPOST.nnn Posting account file. This file contains records for each account code/cost centre code combination actually used during the posting of transactions. It provides the link between the transaction file (NTRAN) and the balances file (NVALS). NPOSTNDX.nnn Posting account index file. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the posting master file more quickly. NREPS.nnn User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the general ledger in use. NREPS2.nnn User-defined schedule parameters file. This file contains the schedule parameters that are specific to the general ledger in use. NRULENDX.nnn Apportionment rules file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular apportionment rule information for the selected cost centre or account code. NRULES.nnn Apportionment rules file. This file contains the apportionment rules parameters defined for each cost centre and/or account code. NTANLNDX.nnn Transaction analysis file index. The index file enables Sigma General Ledger to locate particular information in the transaction analysis file. NTRAN.nnn Transaction file. This file contains all the transactions entered against each account code/cost centre code combination. Transactions are normally maintained on this file throughout the current financial year but you may override this if you wish. The transactions are linked to the balances kept for each account in the balances file (NVALS) by the posting account file (NPOST). NTRANANL.nnn Transaction analysis file. This file contains the analysis codes entered for each transaction record. NVALS.nnn Balances file. This file maintains the period values (current year actuals, prior year actuals, original budgets, first revision budgets, second revision budgets and prior year budgets) for each account in the ledger. The actuals are linked with the transaction file (NTRAN) by the posting account file (NPOST). LROW.xxx Spreadsheet Link row index file. One file is created for each Spreadsheet Link index that you create. LCOL.xxx Spreadsheet Link column index file. One file is created for each Spreadsheet Link index that you create. Sigma General Ledger also creates the following system and user files: CONTuu.OMS Private user control file. LPARM.OMS The Spreadsheet Link parameter file. NCONT.OMS The Sigma General Ledger system control file. NDELTNDX.nnn Temporary index file used during period end processing. NEXTssuu.nnn User-defined schedule output file for input to spreadsheet or database (ss is the schedule number). NLEDGER.OMS Sigma General Ledger file. This file contains a list of the general ledgers that you have defined. NLOK.OMS Report writer locking file. NLOK2.OMS Schedule writer locking file. NREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are available to all general ledgers in use. NREPS2.OMS User-defined schedule parameters file. This file contains the schedule parameters that are available to all general ledgers in use. NREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). NSCHssuu.nnn User-defined schedule output file (ss is the schedule number). NSORTAuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined schedules. NSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined schedules. NSUBSuu.nnn Transaction processing file. NSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each ledger. NUSERSEL.OMS User-defined schedule selection choices file. NWKANLuu.nnn Temporary transaction analysis file. NWORKuu.nnn Temporary transaction file. Sigma Cash creates the following data files for each cash book: QBANK.nnn Bank accounts master file. This file contains all of the bank account details that you have set up for the cash book. Whenever you enter transactions, this master file is checked to ensure that the bank details specified are valid. QBANKBAL.nnn Bank account period end balances file. This file contains the current and prior year's period end balances and movements. QBANKNDX.nnn Bank account master file index. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the bank account files. QBKRECbb.nnn Bank account statement file. This file contains all of the statement details entered for each of your bank accounts. QCQLY.nnn Cheque layout parameter file. This file contains the cheque layout parameters held for each bank account and is used by the cheque writer facility. QDETSbb.nnn Transaction details file. This file contains the VAT and nominal analysis breakdowns for each transaction. QDSNDXbb.nnn Transaction enquiry index file. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the transaction files during enquiries. QDTSxx.nnn Transaction details file for open batches. This file contains the VAT and nominal analysis breakdowns for each transaction in open batches. QDUMPbb.nnn Recurring transactions file. This file contains details of the recurring transactions that you have set up for your bank accounts. QDYINTpp.nnn Dynamics general ledger interface file for period pp. QNAME.nnn Name and address details file. This file contains all of the name and address details that you have entered into the cash book. QNAMENDX.nnn Name and address index file. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the name and address file. QNARxx.nnn Open batch narrative file. This file contains the header analysis details entered for each transaction in open batches. QNARRbb.nnn Transaction narrative file. This file contains the header analysis details entered for each transaction. QNINT.nnn Interface file. This file is only used if you are interfacing the cash book with a Sigma General Ledger. QNOMS.nnn Internal nominal codes file. This file is only used if you are not interfacing your cash book with a Sigma General Ledger general ledger. QNOMSNDX.nnn Internal nominal codes index file. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the internal nominal codes file. QOPEN.nnn Open batch headers file. This file contains the batch header details of all open batches on the system. QPARM.nnn Parameter file. This file contains a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the cash book to be processed. It includes such items as currency details, exchange rates, transaction definitions, and so on. QPARMNDX.nnn Parameter index file. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the parameter file. QPAYE.nnn Payee name file for name and address details. QPAYENDX.nnn Payee name index file. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the payee name file. QPAYS.nnn Payments file. This file contains a list of the items to be paid by cheque when using the cheque writer. QRCbbNDX.nnn Reconciliation index file. This file is used to display items for reconciliation in the sequence required. QREPS.nnn User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the cash book in use. QSCODEbb.nnn Service code file. This file holds details of items assigned to service codes but which have not yet been reconciled. QTRANbb.nnn Transaction file. This file contains all the current and post-dated transactions entered against the bank account. QTRNxx.nnn Open batch data file. This file holds the data for all open batches on the system. QTRNDXbb.nnn Transaction index file. The index file enables Sigma Cash to locate particular information in the transaction file. Sigma Cash also creates the following system and user files: CONTuu.OMS Private user control file. QCONT.OMS The Sigma Cash system control file. QEXTrruu.nnn User-defined report output file for input to spreadsheet or database (rr is the report number). QLEDGER.OMS Sigma Cash ledger file. This file contains a list of the cash books that you have defined. QLOK.OMS Report writer locking file. QPRNTRbb.nnn Temporary file containing details of deleted recurring transactions. QPTMP1uu.nnn QPTMP2uu.nnn Temporary files used during printing of nominal analysis report. QPTNDXuu.nnn Temporary index file used during printing of nominal analysis report. QRECURuu.nnn Temporary file used during entry of recurring transactions. QREPrruu.nnn User-defined report output file (rr is the report number). QREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). QREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that may be used by all cash books. QSORTAuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. QSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. QSREJxx.nnn Statement import rejected records file. QSTATxx.nnn Statement import file. QSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each cash book. QTMPxx.nnn Temporary file used during transaction entry. QTRSuu.nnn Temporary transaction details index file. QUSERbbb.nnn Transaction import file for batch bbb. QUSERSEL.OMS User-defined report selection choices file. QWKNDXuu.nnn Temporary index file used during interface from other Sigma Systems modules. QWRKuu.nnn Temporary index file used during interface from other Sigma Systems modules. Sigma Asset creates the following data files for each asset register: XANCL.nnn Ancillary parameter file. This holds details of special description categories and weightings for Accelerated Cost Recovery depreciation XCCA.nnn Asset register CCA master file XCCATABL.nnn CCA index tables file XCOST.nnn Cost centre splitting file XDESC.nnn Special descriptions ancillary file. This holds all special descriptions XDESCNDX.nnn Special descriptions and payment details index file. XDHISNDX.nnn History file index by event date. XDYINTpp.nnn Dynamics general ledger interface file for period pp XEHISNDX.nnn History file index by event type. XHIS1.nnn Acquisitions and disposals history file XHIS2.nnn Depreciation history file XLOCN.nnn Location splitting file XMAST.nnn Asset register master file. This holds all asset records XMASTNDX.nnn Asset register master aster file index. XNINT.nnn Sigma General Ledger interface file XPARM.nnn Parameter file. This holds a series of parameter tables that hold details of exactly how you want the asset register to be processed. It includes such items as depreciation categories, ownership categories, history retention parameters and so on, which you specify. XPARMNDX.nnn Parameter file index. XPAYS.nnn Rental and lease payment file. This contains all rental and lease payment data. XREPS.nnn User-defined reports parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that are specific to the asset register in use. XTABNDX.nnn CCA index tables index file. Sigma Asset also creates the following system and user files: CONTuu.OMS Private user control file. XCONT.OMS The Sigma Asset system control file. XEXTrruu.nnn User-defined report output file for input to spreadsheet or database (rr is the report number). XLEDGER.OMS Sigma Asset register file. This file contains a list of the asset registers that you have defined. XLOK.OMS Report writer lock file. XREPrruu.nnn User-defined report output file (rr is the report number). XREPrruu.HTM HTML report output file (rr is the report number). XREPS.OMS User-defined report parameters file. This file contains the report parameters that may be used by all asset registers. XSORTAuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. XSORTBuu.nnn Temporary sort file used during production of user-defined reports. XSYS.nnn System locking/block file for each asset register. XUSERSEL.OMS User-defined report selection choices file.

text: Error running Sigma on Windows 10 32 bit O/S 16bit MS-DOS Subsystem error running any actions in Sigma client on Windows 10 32bit operating system. title: Sigma Index Error
text: Index error Message displayed **** INDEX ERROR () **** on index in module is the name of the program and is the file channel that the program used; this will assist in fault diagnosis. is the full path name of the index file concerned. Resolution Code Meaning Suggested action 2 File not found Recreate the index by re-indexing (via application menu Tools>re-index) 3 Path not found Check data path file settings 5 Access denied Check permissions\file flagging. Connection issue - reboot and re-index files. 8 Insufficient memory Check free conventional memory. Index error 0 Error Meaning Suggested action Index seek error Cannot find a record key Recreate index by re-indexing Index read/write error Disk Failure Check disk for errors. Restore files if not recoverable Index file not open File is not open Contact Sigma Support Corrupt index block Cannot find a record key Recreate index by re-indexing Key has zero length Tried to add blank key Contact Sigma Support Key length exceeds maximum Probably data corruption Re-index, if persists contact Sigma Support Cannot open index file Index file missing Re-index Bad index file header File is not an index type Re-index Key record number is zero Probably data corruption Re-index, if persists contact Sigma Support
description:
Index error

 

Message displayed

 

**** INDEX ERROR (<code>) **** <error> on index <channel. - <file> in module <module>

 

<module> is the name of the program and <channel> is the file channel that the program used; this will assist in fault diagnosis. <file> is the full path name of the index file concerned.

 

Resolution

Code     Meaning                     Suggested action

   2            File not found             Recreate the index by re-indexing (via application menu Tools>re-index)
